info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 10:46PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Fremont and western Teller Counties through 1115 PM MDT... At 1045 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 8 miles north of Texas Creek, or 18 miles northeast of Hayden Pass Burn Scar, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Fremont and western Teller Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
